Comment: Judges 5:10  You who sit on saddles ...  This rule only applies to Restrictive Relative Clauses; in Descriptive Relative Clauses we want a Relative Pronoun.  I'm using PRO in this rule rather than Big Pro Plus because all constituents in an NP with Big Pro Plus get deleted, but we need to keep the prepositions in these relative clauses. Gen. 22:4 ... the place that God told him about.  Delete an AdjP if there is one, as in Gen. 16:1 ... a slave named Hagar who (female) was from Egypt.-*-
